author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Hydraulic failure forces emergency landing of AI flight at Delhi Airport - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Hydraulic failure forces emergency landing of AI flight at Delhi Airport
A hydraulic failure in an Air India flight from Varanasi which had 153 people onboard made an emergency landing at the Delhi Airport.
The pilot saw smoke on the undercarriage and decided to land at the Indira Gandhi International Airport. He asked for immediate evacuation. The emergency evacuation took place in a hurry, some passengers suffered minor injuries.
According to sources from the airport, “Air India flight AI 405 from Varanasi to Delhi had an emergency landing here as the pilot reported hydraulic failure. All passengers were evacuated safely. However, four-five of them sustained minor injuries during evacuation.”
The airline claims that none of the passengers were injured. All the 146 passengers were evacuated and taken to the terminal building.
